subject: Self Care
title: Perfectionism and Self-Kindness
description: A fast breakdown of Perfectionism and Self-Kindness for builders.

hook.text: The project was 95% perfect. She spent three more hours on the last 5%. Perfectionism stole time from her life.

buildup.text: Perfectionism is self-criticism wearing a mask of excellence. It demands flawless performance to earn self-worth.

discovery.text: Research links perfectionism to anxiety, depression, and burnout. It harms health while pretending to ensure quality.

twist.text: Self-compassion doesn't lower standards. It removes the punishment for falling short. Standards stay. Suffering goes.

climax.text: Aim for excellence, not perfection. Excellence allows humanity. Perfection demands the impossible and punishes you for it.

punchline.text: Excellence allows mistakes. Perfectionism punishes them.

quiz.question: How does self-compassion relate to perfectionism?
options: It removes the punishment for falling short while maintaining standards
